ThingDef.Name: MechHydraulicEmpress
ThingDef.label: hydraulic empress
ThingDef.description: An ultra-heavy war queen variant with a built-in mech gestator. The empress bears the nickname "The walking fortress" due to its excellent versatility in both attack and defence. For attack, the empress wields a dual mech chaingun from the front and the back, which both delivers unrelenting punisment at long distances. For defense, the empress is heavily cladded with armor platting that renders ordinary small arms useless, and capable of fabricating an aggressive squad of hydraulic knights and depoly them in battle. Such a powerful mech variant can reduce any colony, that doesn't possess any effective countermesure against it, into rubble. Theoratically, a lone hydraulic empress is enough to wipe-out an entire colony, if unprepared.

ThingDef.Name: MechDragonWarlord
ThingDef.label: dragon warlord
ThingDef.description: An ultra-heavy hybrid variant of a warqueen and an apocriton. The warlord is the most devious of all mech bosses ever discovered, well protected by a monstrous shield bubble, able to fire laser bolts using a mech laser blaster, can fabricate a legion of dragon knights to defend itself, and can resurrect them when fallen in battle. The warlord is designed to be a solution againts spacer-tech factions, according to official glittertech archives and various combat transcripts, multiple high-tech colonies from multiple core worlds collapsed due to the arrival of the dragon warlord, along with it's cadre of dragon knights.

ThingDef.Name: MechDragon
ThingDef.label: steel wyvern
ThingDef.description: A heavy-class diabolus variant, and one of the most destructive mech variant ever concieved. The steel wyvern possess the highest health out of all the mech bossess, and that monstrous health is cladded with layers of armor plating. The steel wyvern is capable of spamming charge blasts and plasma blasts through its mouth, and fires laser bolts through its back as support. All this specs were concieved by the mech hive in their intension to create the deadliest siege beast that ever exist, and after years of pain and destruction caused by the aforementioned siege beast, it's safe to say that it had succeeded.

ThingDef.Name: MechPestilence
ThingDef.label: pestilence
ThingDef.description: An ultra-heavy apocriton variant mechanoid, who specializes in spreding life threatning toxins in the atmosphere. The pestilence has the ability to spread hazardous fumes in a wide area, preventing any organics from drawing near, all while forcing them away from their defensive position, giving its mech allies an opportunity to push forward. This type of mech oftenly spawns alongside the empress and the warlord, serving as their main support by gassing the defenders and drastically lowering their defensive capabilities.

ThingDef.Name: MechMilitorQueen
ThingDef.label: militor queen
ThingDef.description: Another ultra-heavy war queen variant with a built-in mech gestator. This mechanoid is capable of gestating a group of militor mk2 en mass and provide relative distraction and destruction at the same time, all while providing cover fire using its mech orbital beam targeter. The militor queen only spawns during a supreme apocriton raid, serving as the ultra boss's reliable support.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the militor, now with a shield generator pack and an ability to wield a plethra of light-weight mech weapons in its mechanical hands.

ThingDef.label: scyth urchin
ThingDef.description: A small, deployable combat mechanoid variant produced by the supreme apocriton. The scyth urchin has blades that was permanently installed and can use it to cut enemy combatants to pieces, and like the war urchin, the scyth urchin also specializes in swarm tactics in which it can overwhelm and subdue enemies using numerical superiority.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the militor, now with a shield generator pack and an ability to wield a plethra of light-weight mech weapons in its mechanical hands.

ThingDef.label: hydraulic knight
ThingDef.description: A powerful mech variant holding a mech mono sword. This mech is increadibly fast where it can chase down slow moving organics with ease, and it possess quick reflexes which alows for faster and more precise melee hits. The hydraulic knight is mostly seen accompanying the hydraulic empress, serving as its sworn sword and creator.

ThingDef.label: hydraulic knight
ThingDef.description: A powerful mech variant holding a mech mono sword. This mech is increadibly fast where it can chase down slow moving organics with ease, and it possess quick reflexes which alows for faster and more precise melee hits. The hydraulic knight is mostly seen accompanying the hydraulic empress, serving as its sworn sword and creator.

ThingDef.label: dragon knight
ThingDef.description: A highly aggressive mech variant who serves the dragon warlord. The dragon knight uses a variety of mech ranged weapons ranging from a tri-shot charge lance to a full auto assault charger, all while being protected by a low frequency shield bubble. The capabilities of the dragon knight truely shines when fighting alongside the dragon warlord along with the rest of its dragon knights, which also spells doom to their organic foes.

ThingDef.label: hydraulic paladin
ThingDef.description: One of the few tankiest mech variant grunt ever existed. The paladin is cladded with the same armor plating that the mech bosses uses, but not too much that it would overload its mechanical rotors. Though in exchange for more armor, its movement speed would be lowered which it will pose a problem in chasing down agile opponents, but the paladin has a built-in grenade launcher that shoots stun grenades at enemies for easy takedowns. The paladin is mostly seen whenever a mech boss appears in the distance, serving as their faithful guards in the battlefield.

ThingDef.label: mech samurai
ThingDef.description: One of the most dangerous mech variant grunt ever created, built specifically for aggressive skirmishes against larger settlements throughout the rim. The mech samurai has low armor, but its attacks are swift and accurate which leaves the enemy with little opportunity to retaliate. The samurai is also increadibly fast, where running away is impossible unless you're bionicaly enhanced. According to official records after salveging the samurai's artificial brain, its battle prowess originated from a famous samurai general from feudal era japan. His name were never recorded, for the mechanoids never cared about that after defeating him and stole his brain.

ThingDef.label: mech psionic
ThingDef.description: A mechanoid variant capable of using AOE psycast abilities. The psionic has an artificial psycast brain inside its mechanical head, which was mass produced by the mech hive for devious motives. The psionic can cast at least cast two psycast abilities which includes but not limited to, the ability fire an explosive psychic bullet, and the ability to cast berserk pulse on multiple enemies. But despite all this, the psionic is the weakest of all the mech variants in terms of health and armor, but through combat prowess and use of psycast abilities, it is one of the most annoying enemy to deal with.

ThingDef.label: hydraulic guardian
ThingDef.description: One of the tankiest and largest mech variant grunt ever concieved, and probably considered a mech boss despite its status as a mech variant grunt. The guardian is built specifically for invasions, where it is capable of facing a storm of bullets from the defending force and still continues to push through. The guardian is also versatile in both close, medium, and ranged combat, where it can take down enemies at long range using its charged battle rifle and a built-in rocket launcher, repel approaching enemies with a laser blaster turret, and stun enemies that are too close with a stun grenade launcher. The guardian only spawns during a supreme apocriton raid, serving as the ultra boss's valiant protector and executioner.

ThingDef.label: alpha centipede
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the centipede, now with more armor and health capable of deflecting bullets from small firearms, and armed with one the best heavy weapons that the mech hive has to offer.

ThingDef.label: alpha lancer
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the lancer, now with faster movement speed for quicker response and interception.

ThingDef.label: alpha scyther
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the scyther, now with four blades for improved DPS. The alpha scyther is oftenly seen in packs with other alpha scythers, making them a serious threat to anyone who's not well versed in melee combat.

ThingDef.label: alpha pikeman
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the pikeman, now with more armor and a slightly increase in movespeed.

ThingDef.Name: MechSupremeApocriton
ThingDef.label: supreme apocriton
ThingDef.description: The harbinger of death, and the all-father of apocritons. The supreme apocriton is an ultra-heavy mech variant which is believed to be the sole progenitor of all apocritons that exist today, and like the apocritons, it also has a deep hatred towards all natural life to an extreme degree. Its total abilities are unknown other than its ability to resurrect mechanoid allies, and it is the only mech variant capable of wielding the infamous mech heavy laser blaster. The supreme apocriton oftenly spawns with a cadre of hard to defeat mech variants, but luckly, it never spawns normally unless summoned using a "god slayer" mech transponder.

ThingDef.Name: MechSupremeApocritonOffShoot
ThingDef.label: supreme apocriton offshoot
ThingDef.description: An offshoot created by the image of the supreme apocriton, meant to provide support by wielding the original's power to achieve victory.

ThingDef.label: valkyrian
ThingDef.description: An extremely agile mechanoid that personifies the valkyries of norse mythos. With a mech lance on one hand, the valkyrian can push through enemy defenses and impale enemy soldiers within seconds. The valkyrian is also unfazed when hit with bullets while closing in, and possess a handful of skills that are effective against singular and group targets. The valkyrian only spawns during a supreme apocriton raid, serving as the ultra boss's elite soldiers.

ThingDef.label: gamma beam graser turret
ThingDef.description: A heavy laser turret that shoots high intensity gamma ray that burns anything in its wake.

ThingDef.label: laser blaster turret
ThingDef.description: A heavy laser blaster turret that shoots deadly laser bolts onto enemies of great quantity.

ThingDef.label: chaingun turret
ThingDef.description: A stub chaingun turret that can shoot armor piercing bullets at the back.

ThingDef.label: laser blaster turret
ThingDef.description: A heavy laser blaster turret that shoots even more deadly laser beams onto enemies of great quantity.

ThingDef.label: compressed plasma turret
ThingDef.description: A hidden heavy plasma blaster turret.

ThingDef.Name: MechThunderGod
ThingDef.label: mjolnir
ThingDef.description: One of the strongest mechanoid which is believed to be on par to the supreme apocriton, and the ultimate solution against the ever growing threat of the mechanoid variants. Inspired by the weapon used by the god of thunder "Thor", mjolnir is capable of wielding electrical based ablities that are detrimental to both organic and mechanical enemies, along with few abilities that allows it to dominate the battlefield. It is also immune to both stagger and EMP, increadibly proficient in melee combat, and the only mechanoid that can wield the mech storm lance. The conception of mjolnir is due to the result of the combined efforts of the mechanitors of long ago, who are hellbent in creating a mechanoid strong enough to oppose the mech hive, and to counter the onslaught of the mech hive's powerful ultra bosses.

ThingDef.Name: FalseGod
ThingDef.label: mjolnir prototype
ThingDef.description: An ultra boss prototype created by the mechanitors that malfunctioned, went on an unbridled rampage, and later been assimilated to the mech hive. This prototype thunder god, who became corrupted, possess at least half of the original power of the thunder god so elimination is highly possible, but don't let that fact fool you, since it is still an ultra boss reguardless of it being a prototype.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2 "Assault"
ThingDef.description: A militor mk2 with advanced modifications which makes it highly adept in combat, and able to perform most jobs that a normal human can do.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2 "Heavy"
ThingDef.description: A militor mk2 with advanced modifications which makes it an effective tank, and able to perform most jobs that a normal human can do.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2 "Medic"
ThingDef.description: A militor mk2 with advanced modifications which makes it an effective combat medic, and able to perform most jobs that a normal human can do.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2 "Sniper"
ThingDef.description: A militor mk2 with advanced modifications which makes it a deadly sniper, and able to perform most jobs that a normal human can do.

ThingDef.label: militor MK2 "Specialist"
ThingDef.description: A militor mk2 with advanced modifications which makes it an excellent CnC specialist, and able to perform most jobs that a normal human can do.

ThingDef.label: alpha tesseron
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the tesseron, now capable of firing dual lasers which doubles the amount of frequency that it can spread fire in an open an enclosed area.

ThingDef.label: alpha termite
ThingDef.description: An improved version of the termite, now equipped with the best tools to cause more property damage and anarchy against any colony unfortunate enough to encounter it.
